Name: Mary Montilla
Description:
Mary was chased and stabbed twice in the neck by two men after leaving a bar in the São Cristóvão neighborhood. The weapon used to kill her was found near her body.

In December 2018 Cícero Pereira dos Santos was sentenced to 14 years for her murder.

According to court records, Mary had slapped Cicero after he allegedly harassed her. After the incident, she was pursued by dos Santos and his stepson, Leandro Batista de Souza before being stabbed several times.

> The Public Prosecutor requests the conviction of Cícero Pereira dos Santos for double-qualified homicide, with the qualifiers of futile motive and use of torture in the practice of crime. The defendant's defense, in the final allegations, maintained that he committed the act "under the effect of violent emotion, losing control of his emotional and psychological faculties as a result of the aggressions suffered previously by the quarrels with the victim."

TvT partner organisation Rede Trans Brasil & R7 02/08/2017

Description:
Bruna was stabbed and died at the scene from her injuries. The suspect who killed her stabbed another victim later the same night.

Name: Sihle
Description:
Sihle was on her way home after a night out at a bar in Duncan Village when a man made sexual advances at her. When she refused his advances, the man became aggressive and stabbed her.

TvT project: AWID, 09.08.2017

Name: Paulinha da Silva
Description:
Paulinha was a bar with a man, and after a while they left together. Later that evening a man approached her and stabbed her to death. It took seven hours for her body to be collected.

Name: Ayelén Gómez
Description:
Ayelén went out to visit a friend but she never arrived. Her body was found near a sports club showing signs of extreme violence. She had died from asphyxiation.

> Two employees of the club, located in the 9 de Julio Park in the provincial capital, found her under the southern tribune of Lawn Tennis. They hung up advertising posters, before a rugby match, when they found the body. Ayelén lay naked.
>
> The local press spoke first of "a person" murdered and then "a transvestite." After a few hours and after the recognition of his mother, it was learned that the victim was Ayelén Gómez, a trans woman from Ranchillos, a commune 24 km from San Miguel de Tucumán.
>
> In that same city, on April 19, 2012, she had been arrested, raped and abused by two policemen from the second section of San Miguel. Ayelén denounced these events as soon as [she] regained [her] freedom.

<iframe width="700" height="526" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/2Spa4XDl_qc" frameborder="0" allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" allowfullscreen></iframe>

Name: Akio Willy Costa Cruz
Description:
It is not clear whether Akio identified as gay man or a transgender woman, but female pronouns were used in the original news report, which also referred to Akio as trans.

According to the police, Akio was killed at home by two men who had spent the night with her. After drinking alcoholic drinks, they killed and disembowelled her as well as plucking out her eyes and cutting off her genitals.

Two suspects were arrested and confessed to the crime.

https://goqueer.blogspot.com/2017/07/brazil-gay-man-was-gutted-and-had-his.html

Description:
J. was a nurse who worked in Chiquinquirá Hospital.

While waiting for a taxi to take her to a party a man tried to take her phone and stabbed her in the chest when she resisted. She died three hours later in hospital as a result of internal bleeding.

Source ref: tgeu/22 Aug 2017/Evelin Ferrari and tgeu/21 Aug 2018/Evelin Ferrari
Description:
Evelin was a homeless drug user. Local residents said that at around 2 am they heard gunshots and then a car leaving the scene at high speed.

Note that their murder is included in both the TGEU TDoR 2017 and 2018 lists. Presumably the latter was in error.

Name: Kiwi Herring
Description:
Kiwi was shot 7 times by police in her home in front of her children. Friends and family dispute a report by the police claiming that Kiwi pulled a knife on them when they arrived near her home to answer calls about a domestic dispute.

She leaves behind a spouse and three children.

Description:

Name: Pepper K (“Phoenix”)
Description:
Phoenix was killed by another inmate while incarcerated in the Mansfield Correctional Institution. They were taken to an area hospital but died of their injuries on 25 August.

According to Wikipedia, they had participated in the Black and Pink LGBTQ prisoner online pen pal program.

Note that Phoenix was not included in the official TDoR 2017 list released by Trangender Europe (TGEU) in November 2017.

http://nbc4i.com/2017/08/30/inmate-assaulted-in-mansfield-prison-has-died-ohio-patrol-says/

Description:
Malvilis was found dead in a hotel room. The previous night she had been seen with two men.

Name: Xaynna Shayuri Morganna (“Lili”)
Description:
Lili was last seen alive at around 10pm running in front of the city forum. Several minutes later she was found shot dead in a fetal position on the banks of the Paraguaçu River in a busy area near the town square.

According to the police, preliminary investigations suggest out that Lili was killed by three men who were in a silver-colored Honda Civic car.

Lili was president of the Gay Group of Cachoeira Association and since 2010 had been one of the organisers of the Cachoeira LGBT pride parade. As a result of her death, the 2017 Pride (which was due to happen on 15th October 2017) was cancelled.

https://homofobiamata.wordpress.com/2017/08/27/lili-41-anos-tiros-ba-cachoeira/index.html

Name: Chanda Sharmeeli
Description:
Chanda was shot dead when a group of men in a car threw rotten eggs at a group of transgender people standing in the street and then opened fire on them.

A friend told Al Jazeera that the men in the car were drunk and had tried to force the murdered person to sit in the car with them.

https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/08/transgender-people-targeted-fatal-karachi-attack-170830100715658.html
